 I. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַעֲמָן‎</span>] **noun [masculine]** usually ==pleasantness== (so [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] ***amoenitas***), but perhaps epithet of Adonis (so [[BDB#Mo|Mo]]<sup>Phoen. i. 227</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>Symm. i. 468; Semit. i. 32</sup> who compare red flower called <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [see [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1578</sup>], i.e. ***wound of Adonis***, whence <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἀνεμώη</span>; compare [[BDB#Ew|Ew]]<sup> Proph. i. 364</sup> [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>Proph. vi. n. 10 and</sup> see [[BDB#Lewy|Lewy]]<sup>Fremdwörter, 49</sup>); — only plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִטְעֵי נַעֲמָנִים‎</span> [[Isa.17.10|Isa 17:10]] ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">φύτευμα ἄπιστον</span>) perhaps = ***Adonis-plantations***, or gardens (on double plural see [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:124q»§ 124q</sup>; and on <span class="bdbLangGreek">Ἀδώνιδος κῆποι</span> see Rochette<sup>Rev. Archéol. viii. 1851, 105-123</sup> Daremberg et Saglio<sup>Dict. des Antiquités (1877), i. 73, and references</sup> W[[BDB#Smith|Smith]]<sup>Dict. Antiq.</sup> (3) i. 25 [[BDB#Fl|Fl]] in [[BDB#Levy|Levy]]<sup>NHWB iv. 229</sup>).
